titleStmt.title: The dangers of new discipline to the state and church discovered fit to be considered by them who seeke, as they tearme it, the reformation of the Church of England composed by a Trve Protestant, a loyall subject, a loving fellow member of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland ...
titleStmt.author: True Protestant, a loyall subject, a loving fellow member of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland and Ireland.

titleStmt.title: The dangers of new discipline to the state and church discovered fit to be considered by them who seeke, as they tearme it, the reformation of the Church of England composed by a Trve Protestant, a loyall subject, a loving fellow member of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland ...
titleStmt.author: True Protestant, a loyall subject, a loving fellow member of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland and Ireland.

notesStmt.note: Forms the first portion of a made-up tract, having general t.p. which reads: A discourse presented to those who seeke the reformation of the Church of England ... Printed for W. W. and I. B. 1642.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.

person.persName: True Protestant, a loyall subject, a loving fellow member of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland and Ireland.
